results.title: THE RISK OF COBALAMIN DEFICIENCY SYMPTOMS RELATED TO LONG-TERM METFORMIN USE IN T2DM PATIENTS.
results.text_hl: THE RISK OF @DISEASE_Methylmalonic_Aciduria_and_Homocystinuria_CblF_Type @DISEASE_MESH:C564747 @@@COBALAMIN DEFICIENCY@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012816 @@@SYMPTOMS@@@ RELATED TO @DISEASE_613485 @DISEASE_OMIM:613485 @@@LONG-TERM@@@ @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@METFORMIN@@@ USE IN T2DM PATIENTS.

results.title: Hypoglycaemia in patients with type 2 diabetes treated with a combination of metformin and sulphonylurea therapy in France.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To examine @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@-reported experience of hypoglycaemia, worry about @<m>DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012816 @@@hypoglycaemic symptoms@@@ and the impact of hypoglycaemia on @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@' quality of life associated with use of @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulphonylurea@@@ co-administered with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

results.title: Influence of initial hyperglycaemia, weight and age on the blood glucose lowering efficacy and incidence of hypoglycaemic symptoms with a single-tablet metformin-glibenclamide therapy (Glucovance) in type 2 diabetes.
results.text_hl: Influence of initial hyperglycaemia, weight and age on the @CHEMICAL_Blood_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001786 @@@blood glucose@@@ lowering efficacy and incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012816 @@@hypoglycaemic symptoms@@@ with a single-tablet @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-@CHEMICAL_Glyburide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005905 @@@glibenclamide@@@ therapy (@CHEMICAL_Glucovance @CHEMICAL_MESH:C417231 @@@Glucovance@@@) in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@.

results.title: Hypoglycaemic symptoms, treatment satisfaction, adherence and their associations with glycaemic goal in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus: findings from the Real-Life Effectiveness and Care Patterns of Diabetes Management (RECAP-DM) Study.
results.text_hl: AIMS: This study was undertaken to evaluate (i) factors associated with @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@-reported hypoglycaemia; (ii) association of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@-reported @<m>DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012816 @@@hypoglycaemic symptoms@@@ with treatment satisfaction and barriers to adherence and (iii) association between treatment satisfaction, adherence and glycaemic control among @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@ who added a @CHEMICAL_Sulfonylurea_Compounds @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013453 @@@sulphonylurea@@@ or a @CHEMICAL_2_4_thiazolidinedione @CHEMICAL_MESH:C089946 @@@thiazolidinedione@@@ to ongoing @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

results.title: Durable efficacy of metformin/glibenclamide combination tablets (Glucovance) during 52 weeks of open-label treatment in type 2 diabetic patients with hyperglycaemia despite previous sulphonylurea monotherapy.
results.text_hl: The combination tablets were well tolerated: 11.1% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ reported @<m>DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012816 @@@hypoglycaemic symptoms@@@ (all either mild or moderate severity).

citations.NLM: Blonde L, Joyal S, Henry D, Howlett H. Durable efficacy of metformin/glibenclamide combination tablets (Glucovance) during 52 weeks of open-label treatment in type 2 diabetic patients with hyperglycaemia despite previous sulphonylurea monotherapy. Int J Clin Pract. 2004 Sep;58(9):820-6. PMID: 15529514

results.title: UKPDS 26: Sulphonylurea failure in non-insulin-dependent diabetic patients over six years. UK Prospective Diabetes Study (UKPDS) Group.
results.text_hl: If their fasting plasma @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ subsequently rose above 15.0 mmol l(-1), or they developed @<m>DISEASE_Signs_and_Symptoms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012816 @@@hyperglycaemic symptoms@@@, additional hypoglycaemic therapy was given: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, ultratard @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@, and soluble @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ as required.

citations.NLM: Matthews DR, Cull CA, Stratton IM, Holman RR, Turner RC. UKPDS 26: Sulphonylurea failure in non-insulin-dependent diabetic patients over six years. UK Prospective Diabetes Study (UKPDS) Group. Diabet Med. 1998 Apr;15(4):297-303. PMID: 9585394
